description: From Late Latin plānārius (“relating to a plane”), derived from Latin plānus (“flat”, “level”), ultimately from Proto-Indo-European *pleh₂- (“flat”).

adjectives.description: planular (comparative more planular, superlative most planular)

entries.meaning: Of or pertaining to a plane.
examples: A planular projection of a three-dimensional object is its projection onto a plane.

entries.meaning: Zoology: describing a planula or planulae.
